items.title: Ryan Walters, Oklahoma Education Chief Who Promoted Bibles in Schools, to Resign
items.summary: Ryan Walters had drawn criticism from liberals and conservatives alike over his push to place Bibles in classrooms and bring more prayer into public schools.

items.title: Tylenol Issues Clarification After White House Resurfaces 2017 Tweet on Usage During Pregnancy
items.summary: Tylenol’s parent company, Kenvue, said an eight-year-old social media post was “being taken out of context” as the Trump administration warns pregnant women not to take the drug.

items.title: Times Reporters Answer Your Vaccine Questions
items.summary: We received hundreds of queries about efficacy, safety, cost and access.

items.title: Runway Safety Bed Stops Skidding Plane in Virginia
items.summary: The concrete bed stopped a commercial flight that lost control during landing. The safety system slows a runaway aircraft by collapsing under its weight.

items.title: Democratic Report Says Disorder at DOGE Jeopardized Americans’ Data
items.summary: Members of a Senate panel described a haphazard working and living environment that involved transferring sensitive information to servers “without any verified security controls.”

items.title: What We Know About the Shooting at a Dallas ICE Facility
items.summary: One detainee was killed and two others were wounded after a gunman opened fire on Wednesday. The gunman died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

items.title: Fema’s acting chief reportedly could not be reached during deadly Texas floods
items.summary: <p>Disaster relief agency reportedly didn’t answer two-thirds of calls after criticism for slow response during devastation</p><p>The US Federal Emergency Management Agency (Fema)’s acting administrator was largely unreachable after <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/texas-floods-2025">deadly flooding</a> swept through <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/texas">Texas</a> in July, according to a new report.</p><p>That meant the agency could not deploy search-and-rescue resources as quickly as possible. The federal agency had already <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/jul/23/fema-director-texas-flood-response">faced criticism</a> for its slow response to the disaster in which more than 130 people died.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/25/fema-texas-floods">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Federal prosecutors reportedly gave US attorney memo suggesting not to file charges against James Comey – US politics live
items.summary: <p>Prosecutors in eastern district of Virginia detailed to Lindsey Halligan why not to file criminal charges against former FBI director, ABC news says</p><p><strong>Dozens of House <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/democrats">Democrats</a> have signed a letter to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/donaldtrump">Donald Trump</a> and secretary of state <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/marco-rubio">Marco Rubio</a>, urging the administration to recognize Palestinian statehood.</strong></p><p>The letter, led by <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/california">California</a> Democrat Ro Khanna, has 46 signatures, and lawmakers will send it to the US president on Friday, <strong>according to plans first provided to the Guardian</strong>.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/25/donald-trump-james-comey-fbi-ice-texas-latest-us-politics-news-updates-live">Continue reading...</a>
